subject: Re: [junit] Dinamic tests with JUnit
msgSnippet: Hi Emerson, J.B.Rainsberger s JUnit Recipes (Manning Publications, 2004) documents one implementation if my memory serves me correct. Lasse -- Lasse Koskela
messageBody:
Hi Emerson,

J.B.Rainsberger's "JUnit Recipes" (Manning Publications, 2004)
documents one implementation if my memory serves me correct.

Lasse

--
Lasse Koskela
* Author of "Test Driven" (Manning Publications, 2007) *

On 5/22/07, Emerson Cargnin <echofloripa@...> wrote:
> Can u give me some link with the implementation with junit 3?
> thanks very much for ur help
> emerson
>
> On 5/22/07, Lasse Koskela <lasse.koskela@...> wrote:
> >
> > Hi Emerson,
> >
> > On 5/22/07, Emerson Cargnin <echofloripa@...<echofloripa%40gmail.com>>
> > wrote:
> > > On 5/22/07, David Saff <saff@... <saff%40mit.edu>> wrote:
> > > > Have you Googled for Parameterized Test Case? That might be the
> > > > solution you're looking for. Please let me know if that's not enough
> > > > to get you started,
> > >
> > > is that specific of junit 4?
> >
> > Yes and no. JUnit 4 comes with built-in support for implementing the
> > Parameterized Test Case pattern. However, mankind has used the same
> > pattern with JUnit 3 for several years already--just with a bit more
> > typing involved.
> >
> > Best regards,
> > Lasse
> >
> > --
> > Lasse Koskela
> > * Author of "Test Driven" (Manning Publications, 2007) *
> >
> >
>
> --
> Emerson Cargnin
>
> [Non-text portions of this message have been removed]
>
>
